title: EastEnders spoilers: Maisie Smith reveals Tiffany and Keegan twists
text:
Tiffany Butcher (Maisie Smith) and Keegan Baker (Zack Morris) are set to have a wedding day to remember in EastEnders as the youngsters prepare to elope and tie the knot, incurring the wrath of their families, not least of all Karen Taylor (Lorraine Stanley).

And while it does seem awfully quick for the pair to get wed, Maisie told Metro.co.uk that their feelings for one another are ‘100% genuine’ and she is certainly rooting for them to get their happy ever affair.

She told us: ‘They have been through so much individually and for them to fall in love shows how much they each have individually grown as characters. It’s a beautiful relationship because they’re both so vulnerable – they have a great dynamic I think.

‘They are totally genuine about each other. Because they have been through so much, they have been forced to grow up much quicker than others. I don’t think their relationship is child like at all – they have a lot of love for each other. They’re a bit of a power couple!

‘With any relationship, there is always a risk but as long as they are happy they should go with what they think feels right. There are very few people who are in favour of this wedding but Bernie is one character who wants them both to be happy! However, Karen is the least supportive! We definitely see that in the episodes to come.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It’s absolute chaos! It was so great reading the script – it starts of Tiffany, Keegan, Keanu and Bernie just going to the wedding and when they get there, the entire crowd of the Taylor and Butcher families are just there in this chaos. It was great to film and I can’t wait to watch it!

‘It is just so much fun. I love getting every family member into a room together to do scenes like this – it’s not challenging at all, it’s just a pleasure to work with them all at once.’

And if fans have their way, the couple will make it down the aisle and have a happy ending – as Maisie has admitted to be taken aback by the level of support the relationship has received from viewers, particularly on social media.

She grinned: ‘#Tiffgan! The following is huge, it’s so lovely to have so much support from a fanbase. When I first came back, I was still getting to grips with social media. Seeing some Maisie Smith fan accounts was lovely and since the relationship with Keegan started, the support has just doubled. There are so many fans who just love the relationship. I love watching the little videos that fans make about them.

‘Zack is great to work with, he’s a brilliant actor and I think our chemistry on and off screen is really nice. We bounce off each other well so I have really enjoyed playing out the scenes we have done with this relationship.’

Of course, viewer attention is nothing new to Maisie, who first appeared on the show as a child. Although she admits that it can be odd seeing videos of her sasstastic six-year-old self telling a young Dotty Cotton that she is ‘not flippin’ invited’ to a party.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She laughed: ‘It is weird seeing those. Once the episodes aired, it was sort of forgotten. But seeing your six year old self cropping up is just hilarious. Social media is a great way of seeing how massive it is that I have been connected with the show for so long and fans have supported me from day one and are still there now. A lot of the fans have actually made friends with other fans – it’s great to see friendships blossoming through it.’

But there’s a lot going on for Tiffany outside of the wedding drama. On potential scraps with Dotty (Milly Zero), she teased: ‘Who can say – at the moment, Tiffany doesn’t trust Dotty at all, and never has. I can’t see them becoming friends if I’m honest.’

On a Bianca Butcher (Patsy Palmer) return, she was much less cryptic! She enthused: ‘I 100% want Bianca back. I kept in touch with her from the day I left but actually seeing her again was the weirdest thing and being able to have a conversation with her face to face instead of texting. It was so lovely, it all went too quick. It wasn’t enough, I’m going to start a petition for her to come back.’

One kegacy that Bianca has inadvertently left behind is the sinister Leo, who is targeting Whitney Dean (Shona McGarty), believing that she lied about his dead, abuser father Tony King. But Maisie has hinted that he could get his comeuppance once Tiffany works out who he is.

Advertisement

She revealed: ‘She does get involved a lot more. She knows what Whitney has been through over the years. Tiffany is very wary of any boyfriend because she hasn’t had the best luck. Tiff does get involved with that – if she does find out who Leo really is; watch out!’
